comments.html:
In the AWS case, SRD is used instead of VXLAN/GENEVE to transport customer data, so it's still Ethernet/IP/TCP above it.

Replacing TCP with SRD is hard because the original designers of the socket API wrote QDS code before thinking it through... https://blog.ipspace.net/2009/08/what-went-wrong-socket-api.html

As for "replacing TCP in data center", that article is so full of bullshit that I postponed writing a reply till next year ;)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Wouldn't it make sense to implement SRD into, for example, the linux kernel and get rid of TCP for a lot of applications? I don't see it replacing UDP. But SRD for all of webtraffic? Wouldn't be that bad. I read somewhere a few days ago that we should replace TCP in the datacenter; HA.. I found it again: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2210.00714.pdf They're talking about "Homa", I don't know enough application and transport stuff to know if the Homa idea is good or bad. And how it relates to SRD.
